Static Public Member Functions
sys::Assets Class Reference
Inheritance diagram for sys::Assets:

Documentation

The Assets class is a static class that allows the application to access kernel assets such as fonts, bitmaps, and vector graphics.

Static Public Member Functions

static sgfx::Font * font (int num)

Member Function Documentation

static int sys::Assets::bmap_icon_count ( )
inlinestatic

Accesses the number of bitmap icons available from the system.

static sgfx::Font* sys::Assets::font ( int  num)
inlinestatic

Load the specified font

Parameters
numThe offset of the system font
Returns
A pointer to the font

Here is an example of how to adjust the spacing of the system fonts.

int i;
for(i = 0; i < Assets::font_count(); i++){
sgfx::Font * font = Assets::font(i);
font->set_space_size(4);
}
static int sys::Assets::font_count ( )
inlinestatic

Returns the number of system fonts available

static const sg_bmap_header_t* sys::Assets::get_bmap_icon ( u16  icon)
static

Accesses the specified system bitmap icon.

Parameters
iconThe icon number (offset) to access
Returns
A pointer to the bitmap header or null icon is not valid
static sgfx::Font* sys::Assets::get_font ( sg_size_t  h,
bool  bold 
)
static

Load the system font that most closely matches the specified characteristics

Parameters
hThe target font height. This is a maximum height unless h is smaller than all system fonts
boldWhether or not to use a bold font
Returns
static const sg_vector_icon_t* sys::Assets::get_vector_icon ( u16  icon)
static

Load the system icon specified by the location in the icon table.

Parameters
iconThe icon to load
Returns
